result.execSummary:
The defendant Dawn M. Hase was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 22CM9 & 22CM75 (PLEAS):
CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Michelle P Brekken   DF ATTY:  A.W. Schutte   DF:  Dawn M. Hase appeared. Case called at 9:37 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for a plea and sentencing hearing. ADA Brekken recites agreement.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NO CONTEST to Ct 1 Possess Drug Paraphernalia in 22CM9. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 Possess Drug Paraphernalia in 22CM9. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses 22CM75. Sentencing arguments. 20 days to appeal. Court notes 2 days jail credit in the event of revocation. Court adjourned at 9:45 a.m. 

Crt orders:
In Count 1 in 22CM9:

- I/S 1 year probation. Report to Probation no later than 12 noon today.

- 30 day jail sentence STAYED.

- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

- Court costs of $243.00. To be added to current payment plan. Payment plan adjusted to $50.00 per month.

- DNA Sample and Surcharge of $200.00

- Absolute Sobriety

-  AODA and follow any recommended treatment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
